titlestmt.titleproper: A Guide to the Pinkus family collection of Paul Ehrlich papers FA072
titlestmt.author: Beate I. Hirsch

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-09-02 10:19:23 -0400.

did.unittitle: Pinkus family collection of Paul Ehrlich papers

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials
separatedmaterial.p: Ehrlich, Paul, Abhandlungen uber Salvarsan, Band I-IV, J. F. Lehmann, Munchen, 1911-1914
Mentberger, Victor, Entwicklung und gegenwartiger Stand der Arsentherepie der Syphilis, Gustav Fisher, Jene 1913.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research with select materials restricted as noted. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: FA136 Paul Ehrlich and Martha Marquardt papers.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Hermann Pinkus' father, Felix Pinkus was born April 4, 1868 in Berlin. In 1883 Felix's cousin Hedwing Pinkus was introduced to Paul Ehrlich in Felix's home, an event which led to the marriage of Hedwig to Paul Ehrlich in August 1883.

Felix Pinkus went on to study medicine in Berlin and Freiburg, later specializing in dermatolgy in Breslau under Albert Neisser. He returned to Berlin, becoming director of a woman's hospital and was made extraordinary professor (ausserordentlicher Professor) in 1921. In 1939 he immigrated to Norway and in 1941 to America where he lived with his son in Michigan until his death on November 19, 1947.

Because of his close relationship with Ehrlich and his cousin Hedwig, he attempted to write Ehrlich's biography, an endeavor which occupied his last years. The essay, "Studieren geht uber Probieren" however is the only complete manuscript. He tried to enlarge it and at the same time translate it into English. He also transcribed a few of Paul Ehrlich's copy books, which had been sent to him after their recovery in 1945.

After his father's death, Herman Pinkus tried to have the essay and the unfinished manuscript published, but without success. For the Ehrlich centennial in 1954 he wrote a few articles himself and made an Ehrlich exhibit at the American Academy of Dermatology and Syphilology in Chicago, for which he won first prize.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Pinkus Family Collection, a special collection of the Rockefeller University, consists of correspondence to Felix and Hermann Pinkus. There are some original Paul Ehrlich letters, reprints of various authors, articles, paper clippings and obituary notes about Ehrlich. The many pages of Felix Pinkus' manuscipts remain unsorted. There are some photographs and material used for the 1954 exhibit in Chicago. The Collection covers the period 1872-1971.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: Materials requiring specialized equipment for access (film, audio, video, slides) may be closed to research dependent on availability of the applicable equipment
Brittle or damaged items, or materials otherwise in need of preservation care, may be closed to researchers at the discretion of the RAC Head of Archival Services/Head of Reference.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Various parts of German and English versions of Felix Pinkus' essay on Paul Ehrlich: "Studieren geht uber Probieren". Typed Manuscript in German pp. 1-117 (complete)
Typed Manuscript, copy in German pp.1-27 (incomplete)
Typed Manuscript of enlarged version, in English, pp. 1-128 (incomplete)
Typed Manuscript of enlarged version, in English, pp. 1-53 (incomplete) but different version from version in Folder 3.
Typed pages, about 100, addenda to German manuscript.
Typed pages, about 40, addenda to English manuscript.
Typed Manuscript of enlarged version in English, pp.1-28 with corrections by Felix Pinkus.
Photocopy of manuscript in Folder 7.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Behring, Emil und Kitasato-"Uber das Zustandekommen der Diphtherie-Immunitat und der Tetanus-Immunitat bei Thieren" Deutsche Medizinische Wochenschrift, No. 49, Berlin, 4, Dez, 1980.
Berliner, Arnold-"Paul Ehrlich", Nachruf, Die Naturwissenschaften, No. 36, Springer, Berlin 3. September 1915.
Ehrlich, Paul-"Uber die Sulfodiazobenzol Reaction", Deutsche Medizinische Wochenschrift, No. 27, Berlin 1884.
Studien uber die Cocainreihe", Deutsche Medizinische Wochenschrift, No. 32, Berlin 1890.
"Beitrage zur Theorie der Bacillenfarbung", Charite Annalen XI, Hirschwald, Berlin, 1886.
"Histologie und Klinik des Blutes", Erster Theil, Hirschwald, Berlin, 1891.
"Uber die Amfangsbehandlung der Lungen-und-Kehlkopf Tuberculose mit Koch'schem Tuberkulin", Deutsche Medizinische Wochemschrift, No. 10, Berlin, 1891.
"Die Wirksamkeit Kleiner Tuberkulindosen gegen Lungenschwindsucht", Deutsche Medizinische Wochenschrift, No. 24 Berlin, 1891.
"Uber schwere Anamische Zustande", Verhandlungen des XI Congres fur innere Medicin zu Leipzig, 1892.
"Uber die physiologische Wirkung der Verbindung der Cocainreihe", Berichte der Deutschen Chemischen Gesellschaft, XXVII, Heft 13, Berlin, 1894.
"Uber die Gewinnung der Diphthereie-Antitoxine aus Blutserum und Milch immunisirter Theire" (with A. Wassermann), Zeitschrift fur Hygiene und Infectionskrankheiten, 18. Band. 1894.
Ehrlich, Paul "Zur Kenntniss der Antitoxinwirkung", Fortschritte der Medicin, No. 2, Berlin 15 Jan. 1897.
"Die Wertemessung des Diphitherieheilserums", Klinisches Jahrbuch, 6. Band, Fisher, Jena 1897.
Minutes from a meeting of the Gesellschaft der Charite Arzte, 3. Feb. 1898 Berlin, Klinische Wochenschrift, No. 12, 1898.
Uber die Constitution des Diphtheriegiftes", Deutsche Medizinische Wochenschrift, No. 38. Berlin 1898.
"Normale und Pathologische Histologie des Blutes", Specielle Pathologie und Therapie, Berlin, 1900.
"Uber die Beziehung zwischen Toxin und Antitoxin", Gustav Fock, Leipzig, 1905.
"Die Behandlung der Syphilis mit Salvarsan und verwandten Stoffen', Oxford Press, London, 1914.
"Die Grundlagen der Chemotherapie", Handbuch der experimentellen Therapie, Serum und Chemotherapie, Lehman, Munchen, 1925.
Gron, Kr. - "Paul Ehrlich" necrology, October, 1915.
Kolle, W. - "Paul Ehrlich und Emil v. Behring", In Memoriam, 70th birthday, 1924, Franfurt.
Kossel, H. - "Uber die Blutserumtherapie bei Diphtherie", Deutsche Medizinische Wochenschrift, No. 43. Berlin 1894.
"Weitere Beobachtumgen uber die Wirksamkeit des Behringschen Diphtherieheilserums", Deutsche Medizinische Wochenschrift, No.51. Berlin 1894.
Lazarus, Adolf - "Beitrage zur Lehre von der Emigration des Hern Professor Dr. P. Ehrlich", poem written when Ehrlich moved to Frankfurt, 1899, ( in booklet labeled Jokl).
Neisser, Albert - "Paul Ehrlich", necrology, Archiv fur Dermatologie und Syphilis Leipzig, 1915.
"Einleitender Uberblick. Salvarsan und Syphilis", from Frstschrift, Gustav Fischer. Jena, 1914 (in booklet labeled Jokl).
Petruschky, J. - "Zur Milchernahrung Tuberculoser", Deutsche Arzte Zeiting, No. 13, 1895.
Pinkus, Felix - "Ehrlich als Therapeut", Medizinische Klinik, No.11, Berlin 1914.
"Paul Erlich's Wirken", Medizinische Klinik, No. 40 u. 41, Berlin, 1915.
Pinkus, Felix - "Paul Ehrlich", necrology, Medizinische Klinik, No. 35, 1915 (2) handwritten manuscript of this article, 2 pages.
"Uber die Behandlung der Hirnschwellung nach Salvarsan", Dermatologische Zeitschrift, Band XXI, Heft 9, Berlin, undated.
Sachs, Hans - "Paul Ehrlich und Emil v. Behring", In Memoriam, 70th birthday, 1924, Frankfurt.
Schleich, Crl Ludwig - "Paul Ehrlich", necrology, George Muller, Munchen 1917.
Schuching, Susanne V. - "Uber das Unverseifbara des Kaffee-bohnenols bzw. Des Kaffeewachses, insbesonderedere uber einen darin erhaltenen Oxyaldehyd", Inaugural Dissertation, Berlin, 1937.
Vagedes, K. - "Uber Antitoxinausscheidung bei einem mit Tetanus serum behandelten Menschen", Zeitschrift fur Hygiene und Infectionskranheiten, 20. Band, Leipzig, 1895.
Wassermann, August - "uber die personliche Disposition und die Prophylaxe gegenuber Diphtherie", Zeitschrift fur Hygiene und Infectionskrankheiten, 19, Band, 1895.
Weinberg, Arthur v. - "Paul Ehrlich", necrology, Berichte der Deutschen Chemischen Gesellschaft, Band 49, Berlin, 1916.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Reprints covering the period 1894-1912, 2 reprints undated. Mostly in French. explanatory note by Hermann Pinkus.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
